intro: Dissotidendron, commonly known as the "spiny apple," is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall. The plant has a distinctive appearance with spiny stems and large, palmate leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible when ripe. The botanical features of Dissotidendron make it well adapted to its native environment, thriving in warm, humid climates.
